title: Decision Content Placement
description: A content placement describes a location or place where the content of a proposed decision option is rendered into. It is used to set technical constraints for content that the decision supplies.

repo:etag.title: Placement ETag
repo:etag.description: The revision that the placement object was at when the snapshot was taken.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.title: Placement Name
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.description: An assigned name for the placement to refer to it in human interactions

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.title: Placement Description
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.description: Placement description. It is used to convey human readable intentions on how dynamic content is used in the overall message delivery. That a certain space is a "Banner" in a web page is often conveyed via the description and not by a formal method.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.title: Placement's Channel Identifier
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.description: The channel in which proposition was made. The value is a valid Channel URI. See 'https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/channels/channel'

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.title: Content Component Type
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.description: A constraint for the content that can be shown in the place described by this placement. Component Types for example are: image link, html block or plain text.

items.title: MIME Media Type
items.description: A constraint for the media type of the components that is expected in that placement. There could be more than one media type possible for one component such as different image format.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.title: Placement Identifier
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.description: A unique identifier for the decision placement.

repo:etag.title: Placement ETag
repo:etag.description: The revision that the placement object was at when the snapshot was taken.
